meanings.definition: Not capable of being put into practice or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The plan to build a castle made of candy was impracticable.
meanings.sent2: It was impracticable to reach the moon without a spaceship.
meanings.sent3: Trying to swim across the ocean with a single breath would be impracticable.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of flying without wings was as impracticable as it was beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The idea of growing a money tree in the backyard was simply impracticable.

meanings.definition: Not feasible or possible to do or achieve.
meanings.sent1: It was impracticable to finish the puzzle without all the pieces.
meanings.sent2: Running a marathon without any training would be impracticable.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bake a cake without any ingredients would be quite impracticable.
meanings.sent4: His dream of becoming a superhero overnight was as impracticable as it was amusing.
meanings.sent5: The thought of winning the lottery every week was completely impracticable.
